## Lead

**Blue Line tensions spike as UNIFIL says Israeli wall crosses into Lebanon; Beirut filing UN complaint.**  
- **What happened:** UNIFIL's **14 Nov** statement said geospatial surveys confirmed sections of a new IDF **T-wall near Yaroun** cross the Blue Line, blocking access to **>4,000 m²** of Lebanese land; UNIFIL requested Israel **move the wall**. On **15 Nov**, **Lebanon announced** it will **file a complaint** to the UNSC; AP and Reuters echo UNIFIL’s findings and note Israel disputes the claim. *Assessment:* The wall dispute adds a **legal/diplomatic flashpoint** atop recurrent strikes and drone incidents, complicating de-escalation tracks. **(High confidence)**

**Key sourcing:** UNIFIL (14 Nov), Reuters/AP (15 Nov).

## Regional Spotlights

### Levant / Israel–Lebanon

- **Latest:** UNIFIL detailed wall intrusions southwest and southeast of **Yaroun** and observed further T‑wall construction; it also reported intensified **night patrols** with LAF. Lebanon's presidency moved to **UNSC complaint** on **15 Nov**. **(High confidence)**  
- **Why it matters:** Even absent large‑scale exchange of fires, **UNIFIL/LAF mobility** and local harvest/supply routes face disruption. Insurance premia for **East Med energy and trucking** are likely to stay **elevated**. **(Moderate confidence)**  
- **Watch next 72h:** Israeli precision strikes vs. Hezbollah infrastructure; any **Hezbollah RAM** uptick near **Ayta al‑Shaab / Kfar Kila**; public UNIFIL **spot reports**.

**Select sources:** UNIFIL statements (6 & 14 Nov); UNIFIL night‑patrol note; Reuters/AP on the UN complaint. See full references.

### Black Sea / Ukraine

- **Battlefield tempo:** **ISW (15 Nov)** notes Russian forces exploiting **weather** vs. Ukrainian **drone-based defenses** in **Novopavlivka** direction; **Ukrinform (15 Nov)** reports **265 clashes** in the last day, **>100** in **Pokrovsk** sector; additional **strikes in Kyiv & Dnipropetrovsk** were reported 14–15 Nov. **(High confidence)**  
- **Operational lens:** Ukraine prioritizes **air defense** and **deep‑strike** effects while containing Russian pushes around Pokrovsk/Ocheretyne; **infrastructure denial** tactics (e.g., **Selydove–Pokrovsk road**) continue. **(Moderate confidence)**  
- **Force development:** Western AD support remains crucial; expert takes (Cipher Brief) caution that Patriots harden defense but don’t end the war without sustained munitions/industrial scale. **(Moderate confidence)**

**Select sources:** ISW daily assessments (14–15 Nov); Ukrinform ops updates and sector reports; Cipher Brief expert analysis.
